page.title: 18FOOTBALL, KINGSTON
page.content: There used to be an annual football match played every {Shrove Tuesday.} The Mayor watched the game from outside the old Town Hall in the market place. The pitch was from { {Clattern Bridge}to{Kingston Bridge}by way of the{Market place}and{Thames {Streeet.} One side represented Kingston people of the day and the other side represented the Danes. The game celebrated Kingston's victory over the Danes in the Eighth Century. The football represented the Danish leaders head. The game got so exciting and rowdy that shops were forced to barricade their windows. In 1850 the pitch was moved to the {Fairfield,}but because of this it was not so popular and stopped in 1867. So perhaps the game of football started in Kingston.
